content: witch hat by bitter yttrium september 2022 well this one is kind of self-explanatory it s almost halloween so of course we all need witch hats it s a fairly simple and straightforward design knit in the round from point to brim i have of course knit my own hat in black but you can choose any colour you like make it stripy or even add in some proper colour work in fact with orange and white stripes it would even make quite a good traffic cone hat i ve also included optional instructions for an eyelet row just before the shaping for the brim begins just in case you want to thread a ribbon through it i ve included instructions for 3 sizes corresponding roughly to child women s and men s hat sizes approx 19 21 23 inch in circumference although it s quite a forgiving hat at least with the paintbox aran yarn i used and can stretch a fair bit to adjust for other sizes you can reduce or increase the stitch count of the circumference by 8 by knitting 8 more or fewer row in the increase pattern to adjust the shaping for the brim alter the number of knit stitches between each pair of increases although if you make a much bigger hat you might want to increase the number of row in the brim so it looks like a proper witch hat and not a gnome hat where necessary the instructions for the smallest size are written first with the corresponding instructions for the larger sizes written in brackets afterwards disclaimer i haven t had time to knit the biggest size myself yet i ve done some calculations to estimate the yardage needed but it s worth being aware of your own gauge as to whether you ll need an extra ball of yarn but hey it s a free pattern materials 1 1 2 balls of 100g aran yarn in the colour of your choice 5mm double-pointed needles 5mm 24 circular needle for the brim - although i m stubborn and kept mine on dpns until the bitter end tapestry needle ©2022 bitter yttrium abbreviations co cast on k knit p purl kfb knit in the front and back of the same stitch to increase k2tog tbl knit 2 stitches together through the back loop yo yarn over to increase stitch count by one k2tog knit 2 stitches together to decrease stitch count by one gauge 4 inch = 18 stitches and 24 row in stockinette main part of the hat westartbycastingonatthetipofthehatandknitthebodyofthehatfromtoptobrim it seasiertoworkthefirstcouple of row over 3 dpns but by the first increases on round 4 i like to divide them equally over 4 needles and place a marker on each needle to divide the stitches in half then for every increase row if the round number is divisible by 4 but not 8 i e 4 12 20 etc i know to increase into the first stitch on the needle
